control.im package¶

Submodules¶

control.im.vector module¶

This module includes vector control methods for induction motor drives.

class control.im.vector.CurrentCtrl(pars)¶

Bases: object

A current controller corresponding to the paper “Flux-linkage-based current control of saturated synchronous motors”:

https://doi.org/10.1109/TIA.2019.291925

The continuous-time complex-vector design corresponding to (13) is used here. This design could be equivalently presented as a 2DOF PI controller. For better performance at high speed with low sampling frequencies, the discrete-time design in (18) is recommended.

output(i_s_ref, i_s)¶

Compute the unlimited voltage reference.

Parameters:

  • i_s_ref (complex) – Stator current reference.

  • i_s (complex) – Measured stator current.

Returns:

  • u_s_ref (complex) – Unlimited voltage reference.

  • e (complex) – Error (scaled, corresponds to the leakage flux linkage).

update(e, u_s_ref, u_s_ref_lim, w_s)¶

Update the integral state.

Parameters:

  • e (complex) – Error (scaled, corresponds to the leakage flux linkage).

  • u_s_ref (complex) – Unlimited voltage reference.

  • u_s_ref_lim (complex) – Limited voltage reference.

  • w_s (float) – Angular stator frequency.

class control.im.vector.CurrentModelEstimator(pars)¶

Bases: object

This class contains a simple sensored flux estimator, commonly known as the current model.

output(i_s, w_m)¶

Compute the outputs of the observer.

update(i_s, w_s)¶

Update the states for the next sampling period.

Parameters:

  • i_s (complex) – Stator current.

  • w_s (float) – Angular frequency of the rotor flux.

class control.im.vector.CurrentRef(pars)¶

Bases: object

This class contains a method for current reference computation with field weakening based on the voltage reference. The field-weakening method and its tuning corresponds roughly to the paper “Braking scheme for vector-controlled induction motor drives equipped with diode rectifier without braking resistor”:

https://doi.org/10.1109/TIA.2006.880852

output(tau_M_ref, psi_R)¶

Compute the stator current reference.

Parameters:

  • tau_M_ref (float) – Torque reference.

  • psi_R (float) – Rotor flux magnitude.

Returns:

  • i_s_ref (complex) – Stator current reference.

  • tau_M (float) – Limited torque reference.

update(u_s_ref, u_dc)¶

Field-weakening based on the unlimited reference voltage.

Parameters:

  • u_s_ref (complex) – Unlimited stator voltage reference.

  • u_dc (float.) – DC-bus voltage.

class control.im.vector.SensorlessObserver(pars)¶

Bases: object

Sensorless reduced-order observer corresponding to the paper “Reduced-order flux observers with stator-resistance adaptation for speed-sensorless induction motor drives”:

https://doi.org/10.1109/TPEL.2009.2039650

This implementation corresponds to (26)-(30) with the fixed selection c = w_s**2 in (17). This selection allows to avoid the algebraic loop in (26b). The closed-loop poles, cf. (40), can still be affected via the choice of the coefficient b > 0.

output(u_s, i_s)¶

Compute the outputs of the observer.

update(i_s, w_s, w_r, dpsi_R)¶

Update the states for the next sampling period.

class control.im.vector.VectorCtrl(pars, speed_ctrl, current_ref, current_ctrl, observer)¶

Bases: object

This class interconnects the subsystems of an induction motor control system and provides the interface to the solver.

control.im.vhz module¶

This module includes V/Hz control for induction motor drives. The method is similar to the paper “On the stability of volts-per-hertz control for induction motors”:

https://doi.org/10.1109/JESTPE.2021.3060583

Open-loop V/Hz control can be obtained as a special case by choosing:

R_s, R_R = 0, 0 k_u, k_w = 0, 0

Notes

The low-pass-filtered values are marked with ref at the end of the variable name. These slowly varying quasi-steady-state quantities can be seen to represent the operating point.

class control.im.vhz.VHzCtrl(pars)¶

Bases: object

V/Hz control algorithm with the stator current feedback.

stator_freq(w_s_ref, i_s)¶

Computes the dynamic stator frequency reference used in the coordinate transformations.

voltage_reference(w_s, i_s)¶

Compute the stator voltage reference in synchronous coordinates.
